title: Why Did A Campaign Finance Reform Group Fall Short On Election Day?
teaser: Harvard Law Professor Lawrence Lessig's pro-campaign finance reform group had extensive investments, but failed to get most of their preferred candidates elected. NPR's Arun Rath speaks with Lessig for a post-election post-mortem.
contentencoded: Copyright 2014 NPR. To see more, visit http://www.npr.org/.
